Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the web application, including hosting needs, supported frameworks, and integration with APIs or backend services.
Design the architecture for the static web app, including folder structure, build pipelines, and integration points with Azure Functions or APIs.
Create a GitHub repository for the web application codebase. Ensure proper branching strategies and permissions are in place.
Provision a new Azure Static Web App resource in the Azure portal or using CLI/PowerShell. Link it to the GitHub repository for CI/CD integration.
Set up build and deployment settings in the Azure portal, including specifying the build folder, API location, and output folder.
Enable security features such as custom domains with HTTPS, authentication providers, and role-based access control (RBAC) for the web app.
Perform testing of the deployed application to ensure functionality, performance, and security. Validate integration with APIs and backend services.
Set up monitoring and alerting for the web app using Azure Monitor and Application Insights. Configure alerts for performance metrics and errors.
Create detailed documentation for the application setup, including architecture, deployment settings, and operational procedures.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the Azure Static Web App setup.
Ensure the web app setup adheres to organizational and regulatory compliance requirements. Conduct periodic audits to verify compliance.
